intro: Tragacantha adunca, commonly known as the slender tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Tragacantha adunca is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
